cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 280 miles ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the eastern Gulf toward the north-central Gulf Coast (MS/AL coast)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Mississippi–Alabama coastline (around the mouth of the Pearl River)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect west of Morgan City, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from mouth of the Pearl River to the Alabama-Florida border; Tropical Storm Warning east of Morgan City, LA to the AL/FL border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from Louisiana-Texas border eastward to the Alabama-Florida border
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty winds 20–30 mph possible as outer bands pass
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge around 1–2 ft possible along the Louisiana-Texas border, including Sabine Pass
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands; totals generally 1–3 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and rip currents in the near-shore approaches, but no major operational hazards expected
